results.title: Immigration
results.brief_description:
How the USA has been populated during the last two centuries. For many reasons people left the Old World to try their luck in the Americas - all have found a home in the USA during the past 200 years.
No credits available.

results.title: Immemory
results.brief_description:
Marker charts a haunting journey through memory, cinema, photography, war and literature tracing an itinerary or map of an imaginary country. This voyage takes us from the “Madeline” at the intersection of Proust and Hitchcock through an archive of image and text that culminates as a self-portrait.

(Electonic Arts Intermix)

results.title: Imitation of life [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Universal International Pictures, Ross Hunter and Douglas Sirk
results.brief_description: Two widows, a rising actress and her African-American housekeeper, struggle in their relationships with their troubled daughters. As the years pass, each of the four women realises that she has been living out an emotionally fruitless existence. A film in which the conventions of the ‘woman’s weepie’ are manipulated in a melodramatic schema of American class and race relations. An ironic success story, the rise of Lora (Lana Turner) from housewife to actress, in the first half, merges into intensified melodrama on the theme of race and identity as a light skinned black woman tries to pass as white. Based on the novel by Fannie Hurst. Cast also includes John Gavin, Juanita Moore, Robert Alda, Susan Kohner and Sandra Dee.

results.title: Imagination at work
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Productions and Leon S. Gold
results.brief_description: Shows how to overcome the most common barriers to individual creative thinking - perceptual, cultural and emotional - and the factors which contribute to creative ability - sensitivity, fluency, flexibility and originality.

results.title: Imagination 10
results.creator_credit: Morton Goldscholl Design, Champion Papers and Morton Goldscholl
results.brief_description: This film pays tribute to the railroad and its contribution to America; discusses the type of life and work of the people who run the passenger and freight trains. Shows the aesthetic appeal of steel and steam and the beauty of nature along the right of way and is almost an abstract painting seen from a parlour car window, a montage of people. The film was prepared in conjunction with the publishing of a monograph on a variety of papers used by the railroads.

results.title: Images: my life in film (Text)
results.brief_description: This book was written by Ingmar Bergman. To write it he rescreened all of his films, many not seen since their release. He recounts the making of the films and explores the themes that bind them together, the preoccupations, the anguish, the conflicts. He comments unsurprisingly on his successes as well as his perceived failures. This text is an eloquent and indispensable companion to Bergman’s films.

results.title: Images pour Debussy
results.brief_description: Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau”, and the first and second “Arabesques”. Pianist: Jacques Ferrier.

results.title: Images pour Bach
results.brief_description: A series of abstract shapes and patterns are shown in synchronisation with two Bach compositions - Overture from the Suite for Orchestra No 5 in F major and Invention No 14 in D major are rearranged in modern electronic fashion. Colour and shape recur and vary according to the themes and variations in the musical structure.

results.title: Images of the wild
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Beryl Fox and Norman Lightfoot
results.brief_description: Robert Bateman, Canadian naturalist and international wildlife artist, is seen at work in his studio in Rockwood, Ontario, on location in northern Ontario and East Africa, and at the opening night of a show of his paintings in Hamilton. He talks about his approach to nature, that dominates his approach to painting.

results.title: Images of the land: 100 years of Australian landscapes
results.creator_credit: Queensland Film Corporation and Ian Stocks
results.brief_description: Highlights the work of some of Australia’s most important artists from the 19th century to the present time. Includes the works of Arthur Streeton, Hans Heysen, Russell Drysdale, Sidney Nolan, Fred Williams and others who present us with their visions of the Australian landscape.
